5. [Astronomers raise interference concerns from AST SpaceMobile satellite](https://spacenews.com/astronomers-raise-interference-concerns-from-ast-spacemobile-satellite/) - A prototype satellite launched by AST SpaceMobile a year ago is at times one the brightest objects in the night sky, raising new concerns about its impact on astronomy.

6. [FCC fines Dish Network for botched satellite de-orbit](https://spacenews.com/fcc-fines-dish-network-for-botched-satellite-de-orbit/) - The Federal Communications Commission has fined Dish Network $150,000 for failing to properly remove a satellite from geostationary orbit, the U.S. regulator said Oct. 2 in its first space debris enforcement action."}

4. [ISS Daily Summary Report  8/11/2023](https://blogs.nasa.gov/stationreport/2023/08/11/iss-daily-summary-report-8-11-2023/): Today, the ISS successfully performed a 1.345 m/s reboost using Cygnus Delta Velocity Engine (DVE) thruster starting at 9:35 CT with a burn duration of 22 minutes and 48 seconds.

5. [ISS Daily Summary Report  8/10/2023](https://blogs.nasa.gov/stationreport/2023/08/10/iss-daily-summary-report-8-10-2023/): The crew gained access to the CIR and continued troubleshooting efforts on the Input/Output Processor (IOP). 2. The action to take should be one of the given tools below.
3. The "Action Input" needs to provide a dict similar to {parameter_1: value_1, parameter_2: value 2} to call action.
4. Always use the "finish" tool upon task completion. The final answer should be comprehensive enough for the user. If the task is unmanageable, use the "finish" tool and respond with "I cannot handle the task".
